Name: Mohammad Rajabi Seraji
Overview: Someone with great passion for computer engineering and research. My most recent venture is in the design and development of immersive analytics systems in AR/VR using Unity. However, I have a long lasting love-affair with web engineering, especially front-end development using modern JavaScript frameworks. I've also been a math geek for years, one that never says no to a good problem! ;)

Teaching.title: GRA
Teaching.course: The Virtual and Augmented Reality, Visual Analytics, Interaction, Systems & Experiments Lab (VVISE) Research Group
Teaching.description: The research in the VVISE group spans the fields of Human-Computer Interaction, Virtual and Augmented Reality, Visual and Immersive Analytics, large displays, 3D User Interfaces, and both software and hardware systems.

Teaching.title: RA
Teaching.description: I'm working closely with Dr. Sedighi to bring a new survey on Indoor Localization to life. We're also working of a novel method of indoor localization and mapping in IoT based networks with the assitance of acoustic signals in commodity smartphones. These projects started out as my thesis project, but we saw the potential in the studies we'd conducted and decided to write these papers from our work's results.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Summer of 2018 program. As I worked with react for quite some time, I was able to gather some source materials in order to teach a course about fundamentals of react. In this course I mainly focused on basic characteristics of the framework and introduced concepts such as Web Components, component relationships, event handling and syntax of react and also pointed to some basic Redux matters, as well. In every other session, the students were tasked to complete a code snippet like the one they saw in the previous session and could participate in the learning process by doing this activity. In the end all of them were tasked to create a simple shopping app using the things they'd just learnt. The evaluation for this course is yet to be ready.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: Practical Front-end Design and Development using Vue and Nuxt.js
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Summer of 2017 Professional program. My co-worker, Pouya and I decided to make a workshop in order to teach the fundamentals of the newly arrived Nuxt framework, a framework which offers great flexibility and high performance results. The course required the students to have the basic knowledge of new JavaScript and was mostly an advanced one. During the course runtime, we introduced Vue and its basic syntax and code-style, along with a reactive way of thinking in Vue. We also introduced the basic concepts of Server-side rendering using Node.js servers to serve a hydrated code to the front-end and improve performance and SEO by all means. The students took part in an intensive Nuxt workshop at the end and learned the project structure and policies, made by the team behind it. We were both rated "Very Good" by the students at the final evaluation.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Department of Computer Engineering and IT of Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)
Teaching.description: I was the main lecturer of Computer Programming lab in which the freshmen of our faculty learned how to program using C/C++. During the course runtime, I introduced the students to the new faculty, professors and also the way things work around our faculty. During the course, students worked in groups and did the programming tasks, together. I was ranked the second best lecturer of that semester by the students' rankings.

Teaching.title: TA
Teaching.description: I had three main tasks during this Teaching Assistantship period. First, I was in charge of coming up with a proper mid-term project for the students. Grading a fourth of all projects and home works was also one of my responsibilities. I, also created the student's second homework assignment.

links.title: Homework and Projects in GitHub repo

Teaching.title: TA
Teaching.description: I was the head teaching assistant of the course. My responsibilities included teaching extra classes on practical subjects, making weekly challenges for the students, making the homework questions and also creating the mid-term and final projects. I was also responsible for managing the grading TAs, assigning homework to them and also collect and report their results to the professor.
Teaching.projectText: The repository for the homework and projects are available in the links below.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: Practical Front-end Design and Development using Vue and Nuxt.js
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Summer of 2017 Professional program. My co-worker, Pouya and I decided to make a workshop in order to teach the fundamentals of the newly arrived Nuxt framework, a framework which offers great flexibility and high performance results. The course required the students to have the basic knowledge of new JavaScript and was mostly an advanced one. During the course runtime, we introduced Vue and its basic syntax and code-style, along with a reactive way of thinking in Vue. We also introduced the basic concepts of Server-side rendering using Node.js servers to serve a hydrated code to the front-end and improve performance and SEO by all means. The students took part in an intensive Nuxt workshop at the end and learned the project structure and policies, made by the team behind it. We were both rated "Very Good" by the students at the final evaluation.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Spring program of 2017. In this course I put the main focus on team work and preparing to work as a front-end development team. My students were introduced to working with Git, individually and also as a team. Going forward I taught them about basics of HTML and CSS in a crash course style; this crash course was accompanied by a comprehensive exercise to ensure they're well used to the core concepts. The majority of the sessions, though, were dedicated to the JavaScript Concepts, classic JS vs new one, ES6 and ES7, build and deploy automation tools and bundlers. This course was a dense package of all the basic tools the students needed to go forward in web development area. I was rate "Excellent", again by my students in the final evaluation.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: An Introduction to Front-end Development in Vue 2
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Spring program of 2017. I carefully constructed a series of slides based on the documentations of the Vue and also made 4 sample code snippets for each session. During the course students used to learn about Singletons in web programming and were also introduced to the world of web components. The first session was an introduction into the basics of Vue and reactive thinking, along with a sample To-do app in Vue. We were exploring componentization of a web page and website in second and third sessions. Finally the students were introduced to Stores in vue, which is implemented in Vuex and became acquainted with the concepts of Actions, Mutations and States. Our course work was put to test in final project, in which the students were tasked to create an interactive homepage for themselves using the introduced concepts. The students rated me "Excellent" in the final evaluations.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: Back-end Web Development Using PHP and Laravel
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Fall program. The program was mainly targeted freshmen and other new students of computer engineering/science and was offered in five session (25 hours in total). I was the main lecturer of the course, accompanied by an assistant to help the students keep up with the workshop sessions. During the course, students learned about server-side scripting with PHP; their basic knowledge of PHP was then used as a way to introduce them to Laravel, an advanced PHP framework for web artisans. My task was to gather enough educational material in form of slides, workshops and projects to keep the atmosphere live and engaging. Student evaluations from the course was gathered by the S.S.C and it was rated "Mostly Positive".The syllabus of the course alongside more information about the sessions are available in the course links.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: Basics of Web Development (How to Become a Web Developer)
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Summer program. This program was quite identical to the one that I presented in the spring. Although, there was a little change in my presentation method. In the courses, prior to this one, I used slide presentations alongside practical coding. During this course I focused more on the practical side in order to help the students leaning into the concepts. Course work is available in the GitHub repo. You can also find the course syllabus in the links below.

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Spring program. The program was mainly targeted freshmen and other new students of computer engineering/science and was offered in five session (25 hours in total). In this course, I concentrated on the basic aspects of web development and its basic technologies, namely HTML 5, CSS and basic JavaScript. This course assumes that the learner has close to no prior experience in web design and focuses on introducing the students to the world of web development. I dedicated the first two sessions of the course to a basic introduction and history of web, as well as baby steps towards programming in that world. The other sessions were dedicated to workshops in which the students coded in real-time and compared the results to each other. more information is available in the links below.

Teaching.title: TA
Teaching.prof: Dr. Hamid R. Zarandi - Associate Professor

Teaching.title: TA
Teaching.prof: Dr. Mehran S. Fallah - Associate Professor

Teaching.title: LECT
Teaching.location: Student Scientific Chapter of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Teaching.course: Basics of Web Design and Development
Teaching.description: The course was offered as a part of Student Scientific Chapter's Summer program of 2015. This was my first teaching experience other than my previous teaching assistantships. I used the knowledge of web development, I learned from my summer internships in order to teach the basic alphabet of web development to the students. This course, mainly consisted of HTML 5, CSS 3 and vanilla JS introduction to the students. It served me well, as it was my initial experience of teaching to people other than my university students. In the end, I was ranked "Fairly Good" by the students.

Working.title: Alibaba Travels Co.
Working.firstJobDesc: I am working in the big family of Alibaba as a Senior front-end developer in Jabama team. We're working on a platform to enable online booking of Hotels (both inside and outside Iran), Tours and other means of accommodation. We're are also making a new platform, called the 'Experience', which allows people to buy travel experiences. We're working with Vue.js and Nuxt.

Working.title: Snappfood co.
Working.firstJobDesc: My responsibilities include choosing a modern JS framework for the main web-app of Snappfood, the first online food ordering system in Iran. I researched for a month and benchmarked Vue, React, Preact and Angular in different situations; as a result, my team and I concluded that we'd go with React, a reliable framework with rich community and support. I was in charge of managing my team, creating tasks for the team members, choosing a comprehensive project structure and creating a fine-tuned boilerplate that is reusable in the company's other products. We developed a fully fleshed Progressive Web App (PWA) complying with the latest Google standards from ground up. This web app is now ready for mobile devices and is available at the link below. We worked with SCRUM method and I was my teams sprint manager. Snappfood was a great environment for me to flourish and develop a fast and lite web-app.

Working.title: Fandogh co.
Working.firstJobDesc: I was in charge of a team of five junior developers in order to develop the latest corporation products. The two main product we worked on was "Amirkabir University of Technology's Diner Web App" and "Chavosh: Amirkabir University of Technology's Social Media PWA". We were using the latest Front-end technologies of Vue and Nuxt and also contributing to the Nuxt community on a regular basis. My job was to maintain team stability, represent goals in terms of smaller tasks and assigning them to each team members and also managing weekly SCRUM sessions. For the back-end tech. we used Node.js's framework, Hapi that was changed in order to meet our project specifications. it's also notable to mention that by GitHub statistics of 2017, our organization ranks in the top 5 of our country. The diner project was halted due to some problems from the university contractors but "Chavosh" is alive and kicking :D you can check out for yourself in the links below.  Be sure to also check it on mobile, it's a real treat for the sore eyes ;)

Working.title: AUT
Working.location: Office of Information, IT and Communications of Department of Education of Amirkabir University of Technology
Working.firstJobDesc: I worked alongside a team of talented web developers on the Amirkabir University Support System (Trouble Ticketing) which is currently available at https://support.aut.ac.ir. We worked for the office of Information and Technology of the university and under the supervision of Dr. Mehdi Dehghan. The full description of the project is available in the projects section.

Working.title: AUT
Working.titleDescription: Project Manager and Senior Web Developer
Working.location: Department of International Affairs of Amirkabir University of Technology
Working.firstJobDesc: I was working as the project manager to bring a new "Scholarship System Search Engine" to the university. I was responsible for creating the basic structure of the project, including our technology stack, the method of team-work and also the deadlines. I also worked as a front and back-end developer for this project. We used PHP's framework, Laravel and its template engine in order to develop our backend. We also used JQuery and Bootstrap as the main Tech behind our front-end. The project started with great pace and was released on time. Right now, though, the website is down due to the university’s lack of maintenance and support. We also used Docker as the main means of deployment. You can check out the project repository in the link below.

Working.title: AUT
Working.firstJobDesc: Arang IT is among the top corporations in Learning Management Systems and I learned programming with for iOS platform using Objective-C and also learned the process of Android programming with Java in Android Studio. During this internship, I participated in making of a Learning Management System (LMS) and at the end also learned to code in basic PHP. This was done as a summer internship.

Executive.title: AUT
Executive.titleDescription: Head of Communications and Industrial Connections Department
Executive.location: Student Scientific Chapter (SSC) of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Executive.firstJobDesc: Student Scientific Chapter of our university is a place built by the students, for the students, but unlike Student Council (also known as Student Government), its goal is to create a fun and engaging environment for the students to engage in academic and scientific events. Our responsibilities included holding Talks, Panels, Innovation Fairs, Job Fairs, Scientific Contests, Educational Workshops and etc. The members of this organization were chosen by the direct vote of the faculty students each year. This term was my second round of activity as a member of SSC and my responsibility was to establish a meaningful relationship between SSC and IT corporations that were interested in investing the events or funding scientific fairs. During my time as a member, I participated in holding of many events such as 16th International AUT ACM ICPC, 8th National Linux Festival and etc. You can see a long list of these events and my roles in each of them in the executive experience section.

links.title: Student Associations Office of Amirkabir University of Technology
Student Associations Office of Amirkabir University of Technology Alumni of Computer Engineering Faculty

Executive.title: AUT
Executive.titleDescription: Head of Innovations and Scientific Olympiads Department
Executive.location: Student Scientific Chapter (SSC) of Computer Engineering and IT Department of Amirkabir University of Technology
Executive.firstJobDesc: Student Scientific Chapter of our university is a place built by the students, for the students, but unlike Student Council (also known as Student Government), its goal is to create a fun and engaging environment for the students to engage in academic and scientific events. Our responsibilities included holding Talks, Panels, Innovation Fairs, Job Fairs, Scientific Contests, Educational Workshops and etc. The members of this organization were chosen by the direct vote of the faculty students each year. My role in this organization was to make sure that we have a proper connection with students and alumni who want to present their novel ideas to the industrial leaders of the field. I was also in charge of managing our Olympiad teams, our robotic teams and making sure they have the proper funding and support for their work. One of my other responsibilities was to keep in touch with the outstanding alumni of our faculty and hold occasional (monthly) talks with them as the main speaker. You can see a vast list of events in which I contributed in the executive experience section.

Education.title: B.Sc.
Education.minor: Minor: Computer Architecture and Hardware Design

Research.title: Effects of Jitter in Mid-way Pointing Tasks in VR
Research.description: In this study we are trying to find out the effects of rotational and positional jitter on doing simple 2D Fitts' law tasks.

Research.title: A Survey on Indoor Localization Methods
Research.status: In-Progress, To be submitted to WINSYS 2019 and the next UbiComp
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: This is a partial outcome of my thesis project and that I've been working on for the past year and a half. This is a hot topic in networking and has quite a large demand in the market. We’re conducting a full-on survey based on more than 120 of the works in the literature (from 1998 to 2018) in order to come up with a generalization of different methods, technologies and techniques for indoor localization. The research and questionnaire phases are done by the time of this writing (Oct 2018) and we're proceeding into structuring the results into a well-written empirical research paper.

Research.title: A Novel Way for Device Based Indoor Localization using Acoustic Waves in a WiFi Network
Research.status: In-Progress, To be submitted to WINSYS 2019 and the next UbiComp
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: This is part of my thesis project and I've been working on it for the past year and a half. My main task in this project is to implement different Indoor mapping and Tracking technologies in the literature, both on dedicated and general purpose hardware. I've come up with a new way that combines acoustic mapping, Wi-Fi fingerprinting and Inetrial Measurement Sensors to acquire a 2D map of an indoor environment and actively track the connected users in it. This is a hot topic in networking and has quite a large demand in the market. We've implemented our method and have successfully tested it on five different devices, we're now looking into developing a testing framework for indoor localization methods and are extending Evarilos and EvAAL projects.

Research.title: Indoor Mapping using Acoustic Waves in Commodity Smartphones
Research.status: In-Progress, To be submitted to WINSYS 2019 and the next UbiComp
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: This is my thesis project and I've been working on it for the past year and a half. My main task in this project is to implement and benchmark the current Indoor mapping and Tracking technologies both on dedicated and general purpose hardware. Using the benchmark data I've come up with a new way that combines acoustic mapping and Wi-Fi fingerprinting to acquire a 2D map of an indoor environment and actively track the connected users in it. This is a hot topic in networking and has quite a large demand in the market.

Research.title: Quadrotor Simulation with LQR Estimation in MATLAB
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: In this project we made a simulation of a Quadrotor in MATLAB using LQR feedback control technique. At last we had a visual simulation of a fully controlled quadrotor (with help of a little bit of SolidWorks model)

Research.title: Design a Simple Scheduler Co-design with Spartan FPGA and Microblaze Core
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: In this project we designed a simple program to work on Microblaze simulated core and also a simple FPGA (Spartan 7 series). The goal of this project was to reach a comparison between simple soft-core programming of FPGAs and co-design.

Research.title: FEC Code Optimization in Wireless Sensor Networks
Research.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Research.description: This project involved making a technical report and a poster of the subject. In this subject I explored different coding options in wireless sensor networks and presented it in the Research Method class.

Projects.title: Alibaba Web Application
Projects.description: Contributing to the implemetation of Alibaba's main website using vue.js, Nuxt.js.

Projects.title: Jabama Web Application
Projects.description: I was a senior front-end developer and in charge of implementation of the new front-end design of the Jabama website. This website is one of the first ones in the country that makes it possible to reserve accomodation and experiences, online. We made it using Vue.js, Nuxt and also contributed to the making of the iOS appliaction using React.

Projects.title: Snappfood Web Application
Projects.description: We made a fresh Progressive Web Application using the latest Google standards. This application is for online food ordering and is the most famous and used app in this field. We made it using React.js, the other descriptions are available in the Snappfood job description. Due to the privacy of the project and my NDA, I'm not able to share any code publicly, but if you want to take a look at the project, drop me an email.

Projects.title: Amirkabir Buffet (Diner Web App of Amirkabir University)
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Projects.description: This project was done in Fandogh Co. and its main purpose was to make a new way for the university staff and students to order food from its diner. It’s made using Vue, Nuxt and Node.js, please refer to the full project report in the links below.

Projects.title: Amirkabir University of Technology Support and Trouble Ticketing System
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Projects.description: This project was in order to implement a system that addresses the trouble ticketing in our university. We built this using Nuxt and Vue, full project report and description is available in the links below.

Projects.title: Amirkabir University of Technology Fund Management System
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Projects.description: A system for managing the international funds in our university, using Laravel and PHP. Full report is available in the links below.

Projects.title: Adding networking context switch to XV6 O.S
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T

Projects.title: Making a network based limited strategic M.M.O Game in Java
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T
Projects.description: We were tasked to create a strategic real-time game link Stronghold Crusader but with online support. The game had to implement a number of specified MMO systems, we weren't supposed to use any game engine, instead we had to develop our own engine to make the game.

Projects.title: Make a Simple C to Assembly Compiler
Projects.location: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic)– A.U.T

skills.description: The first OOP language I was taught in the university. I used it for some projects including my RTS game in the second semester and some other projects like implementing Network layers in Network I course.

I also used it a lot during my hardware development era, using it in 8086 programming, Arduino Programming and for a large portion of my Thesis project.

I know React's advanced topics and am pretty well acquainted with Redux, Thunk, Sagas, Helmet and many other react libraries.

I can use it alongside Redux, MobX, Saga and Thunk in a variety of situations. I also used the AR kit for React native to develop a testing application for my final project.

I was a part of Nuxt development team for a while and am pretty good at developing node.js and Webpack servers to do Vue server side rendering. I've done almost 5 big scale projects in Vue and Nuxt (including this site). I feel pretty much at home when developing in Vue.

skills.description: This was the first NOSQL database technology that I worked with. I used it mostly during AUT Diner project. I'm good at using it with mongoose driver in MongoDB and with the corresponding drivers in PHP.

skills.title: Visual Studio Code
skills.description: I've known it for 2 years now, and I think it's one of the most flexible, fast and most stunning editor/IDE I've ever seen. The fact that it's been made using Electron fascinates me and the rich community support and extensions behind it are great for the development purposes. I've been using it non-stop and to develop almost anything since 2 years ago.

skills.title: Jetbrains IntelliJ
skills.description: Before I was introduced to VSCode I used it quite a lot. The code snippet and completion features of it were quite good and its debugging feature made it an ideal tool for programmers, yet its lack of speed made me move to VScode, eventually.

skills.title: Webstorm IDE
skills.description: Refer to my descriptions about IntelliJ

skills.title: PHPStorm IDE
skills.description: Refer to my descriptions about IntelliJ.

skills.title: Eclipse
skills.description: I used it mostly to develop Java programs, I know it fairly well but haven't been using it for almost 3 years, now.

skills.title: Atmel Studio
skills.description: My main tool for developing 8086 and AVR Processor programs. I know it quite good and have been using it for the past year.

skills.title: Xilinx ISE
skills.description: I used it to develop VHDL Programs during my Logic design and FPGA courses. I'm really not an expert in using it but I can do a few useful things like synthesizing and programming a board with it.

skills.title: Xilinx Vivado
skills.description: Refer to my Xilinx ISE description.

skills.title: WebGL
skills.description: I learned it in my Graphics I course and have been learning about it ever since. Right now I can do some basic tasks with it but I'm constantly learning to do more advanced ones with it. I've been mostly using it in form of Three.js and in web related programs.

skills.title: OpenGL
skills.description: This was the main Shader Language we were using in Computer Graphics I course, so I had to learn it in order to implement basic task. I've been also using it in parts of my thesis project. I have planned courses to further expand my knowledge in it.

skills.title: Three.JS
skills.description: Refer to my WebGL description.

skills.title: Unity 2D & 3D
skills.description: I worked as an intern in a gaming company called Black Cube Games and worked with Unity3D and Unity2D in making of Electron and Tales of Bistun games. I also am working with Unity as a paert of my research assitantship.

skills.title: 8086 Microprocessor programming
skills.description: This was the kind of programming we had to do in our microprocessor's course, I've also been programming for these chips in my final projects, my main tool of development was Atmel Studio and Arduino IDEs.

skills.title: Circuit design and analysis using Proteus
skills.description: Proteus was the main tool of visual circuit simulations in computer architecture course, I've also used it in microprocessor’s project and lab and also in my final project sketches. I can develop complex circuits in it and can also simulate a handful of them, too.

skills.title: Layout Design using Cadence Virtuoso
skills.description: Chip layout design and implementation was the main goal of our VLSI course, so I had to use Virtuoso to make the layouts and simulate the chip circuits. I can't do more than basic layouts with it.

skills.title: Linear control system design and analysis using MATLAB
skills.description: Refer to Matlab in programming language section.

skills.title: Interface design using Arduino boards (Uno, Nano, Mega)
skills.description: Due to the simplicity to development, I used Arduino board a lot during the past years, I've especially utilized it in my thesis project and can say am pretty good in developing programs for these kinds of boards.

skills.title: Microsoft Windows
skills.description: I've been working with Windows operating system from Windows 95 up until the very recent Windows 10, I'm also a windows insider.

skills.title: Mac OSX
skills.description: During my iOS development time I had to use this OS, I'm not an expert in using it but can find my way to things ;)

skills.title: Open SUSE
skills.description: I only worked with this OS in order to use Cadence virtuoso for a semester.

Story.text: When I was, a young boy, my father took me into the city ... to see a marching band
He said: "Son, when you grow up, would you be the savior of the broken? The beaten and the damned? "
He said: "Will you, defeat them? your demons and all those none believers, the plans that they have made? "
Well these lines are from one of my favorite bands, "My Chemical Romance", now let's tell you more a bit more about me! ^_^

I was born on May the 13th 1995 in Tehran, Iran. (In case you don't actually know where Iran is, it's a quite big country in the middle east, right between Iraq and Afghanistan :D). We were living in this city for my whole life (or at least till now), a city of 15 million people. I went to primary and secondary school in a usual public school named "Komeil". I can remember I was always a nerd during my childhood (and some also say during my early adulthood years, too :D); I was graduated from primary and secondary school with a GPA of 20/20(A+).

For some reason I started my high school in the oldest high school of this city, Alborz High school (Formerly known as The Americans College) in the city center. This school turned my life quite upside down, I pursued math and physics, seriously, for the first time in my life; attended Math, Physics, Computer and Astronomy Olympiad and was able to get to the final round of National Math and Computer Olympiads. As a high school student I just loved Geometry, Differential Equations and Calculus! I'm sure you can ask from any of my teachers and they'll vouch for me quite passionately (oh I used to drive them crazy with my questions :D I couldn't help it much). My main goal and interest during this era was becoming a scientist, someone who can contribute to the existing mathematical knowledge and be outstanding, while doing it.

After the Konkur (it's the national universities' entrance exam, something like S.A.T) I was ranked 1000 between about 300,000 test takers. My love for the mathematics, coupled with a fascination for tech. lead me to where I am right now, studying Computer Engineering in Amirkabir University of Technology - The second best university of my country. Here I became fascinated with student activities that are there for the students and are also run by them, I became more and more drawn to the Student Scientific Chapter of our faculty by our seniors and eventually was elected as a member of it, for two consecutive terms. I found working as a member of our scientific chapter really amazing, it's comprised of a variety of tasks that I could never even dream of doing as a student, tasks like holding international contests, fairs and talks, communicating with the wide variety of industrial and academic people.

My academic studies started in the hardware engineering field. I passed my semesters with impressive scores (except the third one which I get to it in a moment). I actually love teaching, and this love, coupled with my good scores resulted in me being the teaching assistant of many of the courses. Through this experience I came to know the responsibilities of a good teacher and I could also use my ideas as a student to further improve my teaching methods and skills. Being a teaching assistant, also helped me to establish useful relationships with many members of our faculty and professors. I also participated in two main research projects, one of which is my final thesis; so I can tell I have quite a lot of educational experience to start with, it turns me into a quite good graduate candidate, something I'm trying to do my best to be better at.

As I was working passionately in the SSC, I was also pursuing my career goals, in order to fulfill my purpose in academic studies I needed to save as much money as it's possible, so I started working for different companies in the most accessible field at the time, Web and Mobile Development. I started in the summer after my third semester, working as an intern, learning iOS programming, Android programming and also PHP. Since I was quite more passionate about the UI/UX field, I started learning new front-end technologies that were data driven and reactive, I spent the next three years in this field of work, developing and implementing seamless user experience and interface. I worked in Fandogh, a startup made by a bunch of our department's students with the goal of developing a series of online services to address a wide variety of educational and scholar needs. Working in this startup was one of the best and most refreshing work experiences, I have, because we could work on the projects we like, with the novel technology we prefer and if that's not the dream then what is? :)

Unfortunately due to the financial problems in our country and some unfortunate university events, the startup experience didn't live long enough to reach its final goal. I was off to Snappfood, the biggest online food ordering company in my country. I started working there, developing their new front-end using latest technologies in React. I've been working there for almost a year right now, a place with wonderful people and a functional working process. I learnt the basics of team-work and working for a big corporation in this company. During the last months, though, I was quite obsessively working on my thesis project 24/7 and had to depart the company to pursue my academic life.

I always saw myself in an academic position, from the beginning of my primary school days, up until right now. I don't really think that I've been living up to my full academic potential in the past years and that's the reason I've been trying to change my route, take more online courses, participate in some active research in Computer Graphics, Game Development and HCI. I see myself in a professor's robe in a couple of years and I don't think anything or anyone can stop me from getting there :) so, now that you know almost everything about me, let me tell you more about my hobbies.

My biggest hobby and obsession from my early years were two things, solving math and gaming! yep! I'm a gamer and I'm proud to be one! I don't think that games are for kids, or that they're a simple waste of time, games are just novel ways of telling a story, experiencing the lives you couldn't live and trying the things you can't be even thinking of doing in the real life; in a sentence, games are awesome! (of course I don't mean mind-numbing casual mobile games that make you itch and spend every moment of your life :D). Math on the other hand, don't you really think it's amazing that we can model the world around us using a series of rules, measure it and then solve it using them? if you don't, then sorry my friend because you're quite dead inside :D nothing could ever bring me the satisfaction of solving a calculus or geometry problem after two weeks of thinking and struggling.

I also listen to music quite a lot! and my taste in it is quite ... well ... quite odd :D I do really enjoy classic works of Violin, Piano and their duets, But I also love some proper rock band music like Green Day, My Chemical Romance and likes of so. I think music is the best way to capture a moment in time, in your life, so I have a playlist in Spotify named "Stories", be sure to check it out, it's the story of my life :)

I hope you've found what you came here for :D whatever it might have been! I hope your questions about me were answered in a way, but I also hope you have now even more questions, questions that make you contact me and ask me anything you want :) don't be shy, my contact is available in the Contact section. Be sure to check it out.
